intro: Jacquemontia selloi var. brevipedunculata, commonly known as the short-stalked golden vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
